intro: Wahlenbergia obovata var. cernua, commonly known as the drooping bluebell, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are obovate, with a slightly hairy surface, and it produces small, showy blooms throughout the spring and summer. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
